**3.2.2** **scrollText() function**

[For this part of the project, I drew some inspiration from this article by Khaled Magdy.](https://deepbluembedded.com/esp32-esp8266-i2c-lcd-arduino-ide/)

The scrollText() function is responsible for displaying and scrolling text on the LCD screen
when needed. It takes three parameters: the text to scroll, another text to display on the
second row, and the row number where the scrolling text should be displayed.

**Text Display Without Scrolling:** If the length of the text is less than or equal to 16
characters, it simply sets the cursor to the specified row and prints the text. It also sets the
cursor to the first column of the second row and prints the first 16 characters of the other
text. This is done to ensure that the text fits within the 16x2 LCD screen.

**Scrolling Text:** If the length of the text is greater than 16 characters, it scrolls the text
across the specified row. The scrolling is achieved by iterating through the text and displaying
a substring of 16 characters at a time. The code for scrolling is as follows:

**for** ( int i = 0; i < text . length () − 16 + 1; i++) {
lcd . setCursor (0, row ) ;
lcd . print ( text . substring ( i, i + 1 6 ) ) ;
lcd . setCursor (0, 1 ) ;
lcd . print ( otherText . substring (0, 1 6 ) ) ;
buttonPressed = digitalRead ( buttonPin ) ;
delay (20 0);
_}_
